text: 38th Street was a station on the demolished IRT Sixth Avenue Line in Manhattan, New York City. It had two tracks and two side platforms. It was served by trains from the IRT Sixth Avenue Line. It opened in late 1913, as an infill station and closed on December 4, 1938. The next southbound stop was 33rd Street. The next northbound stop was 42nd Street. It was not replaced by a subway station, though a now-closed passage under Sixth Avenue running between the 42nd Street–Bryant Park and 34th Street–Herald Square stations had exits to 38th Street.http://secondavenuesagas.com/2010/04/15/twenty-years- later-subway-passageways-lost-to-time/ ==References== Category:IRT Sixth Avenue Line stations Category:Railway stations in the United States opened in 1914 Category:Railway stations closed in 1938 Category:Former elevated and subway stations in Manhattan Category:Defunct New York City Subway stations located aboveground Category:1914 establishments in New York (state) Category:1938 disestablishments in New York (state) Category:Sixth Avenue
title: 38th Street station (IRT Sixth Avenue Line)
